text: Gajnik () is a village in the administrative district of Gmina Międzylesie, within Kłodzko County, Lower Silesian Voivodeship, in south-western Poland. Prior to 1945 it was in Germany. It lies approximately north-east of Międzylesie, south of Kłodzko, and south of the regional capital Wrocław. The village has a population of 130. ==References== Gajnik
title: Gajnik
